page.title: 03Fruit Packhouse Brenchley
page.content: Fruit is sized by diameter using a ring guage system in steps of 5 or 10mm. Pears are sized by hand.In large packhouses apple sizing is mechanised.At Tibbs Court bulk bins are lowered into water which carries the apples to a conveyor,small fruit falls through a mesh. Checkers remove damaged or badly blemished fruit then apples pass through holes of adjusted sizes,and collect in separate boxes. The apples are graded for quality and packed into cartons or bags. Grade 1 fruit is the best quality, Grade 2 may be slightly blemished, riper,or misshapen.Sound ungraded fruit may be sold for juice or cider or used in mincemeat,baby foods etc. Packing gives employment for many months as fruit is kept in cold stores until marketed.
